repnme.cdata!:
Ivory Coast - Center West Agricultural
            Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Center West
            Agricultural Development Project for the Ivory Coast was
            satisfactory. The project achieved many of its objectives,
            institutional development was partially successful,
            sustainability is uncertain, and the performance of both the
            Bank and Borrower was satisfactory. Several lessons can be
            learned from this project. First, approaches to extension
            and land management now give full credit to pilot projects
            that start with selected zones and gradually involve more
            farmers and village groups in managing resources. Second,
            the objectives and scope of integrated rural development
            projects should be kept at an optimally manageable level.
            Finally, it is important to have a participative approach to
            land tenure administration.

repnme.cdata!:
Ivory Coast - Center West Agricultural
            Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Key elements of the Center West
            Agricultural Development Project are: (a) crop development
            programs administered by Satmaci involving a set of
            technical packages for coffee regeneration, cocoa
            rehabilitation, and increased production of rice, maize,
            yams, groundnuts and coconuts; and (b) agricultural service
            and institutional support consisting of an improved system
            of extension services including a pilot program with a new
            approach to extension and a training program for 280
            extension workers, the development of village cooperatives,
            applied research, and monitoring and evaluation programs,
            and providing increased autonomy, with improved management,
            to SATMACI's center-west regional office.
